posts.content:
I usually play Bards or Clerics with lots of singing/buffing/resting etc., so I decided to try a character who could go a while as an engine of destruction without have to buff before opening every door or rest after every encounter.

Ultimately, an unarmed DevCritter who would have some (non-spell based) resistances and I came up with the (probably not original) idea of a STR-based Half-Orc Monk.

I envision starting stats of:

STR 20
DEX 14
CON 10
WIS 14
INT 6
CHA 6

Saw this guy http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 49119.html - a HO Monk/Fighter but he doesn't use DC and there's an XP penalty, but the WS/EWS is a plus. I was thinking FTR levels to get DevCrit by level 22, but not if I have to go extra time to get the requisite XP (I don't like "born at level 40 characters" and prefer to play mine from scratch).

I'm wondering if Monk w 4 levels of COT will trigger the extra unarmed attack? Also, is unarmed DevCrit worth it with a threat range of 19-20? Even with 8 APR (haste/flurry), it's unlikely to fire in any round.

Want suggestions on class combo (if any) and whether or not to build for DevCrit or WS/EWS (if I can only get one).

I'm sure I am re-inventing the wheel, but I threw this together for you. I sacrificed 2 points of STR by going from HO to Human, but that solves the EXP penalty problem.
If you don't need to worry about being taunted, move the points from Concentration to any skill you want, like heal, Persuade, Lore, or even Appraise, because they are spare points. If you lower INT to 8, you would only be able to get 10 Spellcraft instead of 20, losing 2 points on your saves against spells.

Empyre65 wrote:I'm sure I am re-inventing the wheel, but I threw this together for you. I sacrificed 2 points of STR by going from HO to Human, but that solves the EXP penalty problem.
Thanks - looks very playable PvM.

Question: does he need Dodge, Mobility and Lightning Reflexes given his high Tumble and Improved Evasion?

Since he doesn't get Perfect Self until LVL 30, maybe get Iron Will, perhaps delay Toughness and get another "Lvl 1 only" feat? I'd like your thoughts.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You could replace Dodge and Mobility with Strong Soul (level 1 only) and Iron Will. That would give you +3 Will saves, +1 Fortitude saves, and +1 saves against Death effects. I actually had it that way, but changed it because I thought you might think it was silly to have 4 feats for saves, but it looks like I didn't need to worry about that.

Dodge gives you +1 AC against one opponent, so it is not useless, and mobility gives +4 AC against all attacks of opportunity, not just ones from movement in combat. The good Tumble is why I did not include Spring Attack. Even with Improved Evasion, a good Reflex save is better because no damage is better than half damage.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Here is another version for you to chew on. I chose Dwarf and CoT to help with some of those saves. This version also further reduces STR by 2 points but I use those points in WIS since as a STR based monk, you'll need all the AC you can get, especially at lower levels. Dev Crit comes 2 levels later at 28 and DC will be lower due to an ending STR of 32. AB is also 1 point lower. However, AC is higher, HP is higher and saves are higher. Spellcraft stopped at 10 but with the Dwarf bonus, I still get the same +4 saves vs. Spells.

I am also a favor of Dodge and Spring Attack if there are enough feats to use. In this leveling scheme, I prioritized 16 levels of monk pre-epic to get the 1d20 fist attacks, CoT over FTR in pre-epic for saves, and lev 20 Monk to get mind immunity.
